wiki.content: Kanye dedicates “Wouldn’t Leave” to his wife Kim Kardashian. Throughout the song, he references past errors such as his rant on Sway in the Morning or the TMZ interview during which he called slavery “a choice”. Despite these incidents, which got him into some trouble, Kim stayed by his side. Kanye expresses his gratitude to her, appreciating that she didn’t leave him and that she sticks with him in hard times. Here we get to see the sensitive side of Kanye, regretting his past utterances and shouting out all the women in the world that put up with their significant other’s choices, like Kim did with his. We also see him describing how, though he is a free thinker and that his so-called ‘fans’ love this particular quality of him, he is still bashed and shamed for thinking such a way. “Wouldn’t Leave” was first teased as one of two tentative track titles for ye, which were seen on a whiteboard shortly before the album’s release. Along with all other tracks, it was first shown in a listening party broadcast from Jackson Hole, Wyoming which could be accessed through the app “WAV.” Read more on Last.fm.
